edu.swarthmore.cs.spoon.interfaces

Interface Phone


  • public interface Phone
    An engine for sending and receiving requests for help between a particular player and all other players

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Boolean getResponse()
      Receives the response to a request for help sent to another PlayerCharacter
      java.lang.Boolean receiveAndRespondToHelpRequest(PlayerCharacter sender, Action task)
      Receives a request for help from another PlayerCharacter, the sender, gets the receiving player's response, and sends that back
      void sendHelpRequest(PlayerCharacter recipient, Action task)
      Sends a message from the owner of the phone to the recipient asking for help with the task.

    • Method Detail

      • sendHelpRequest

        void sendHelpRequest(PlayerCharacter recipient,
                     Action task)
        Sends a message from the owner of the phone to the recipient asking for help with the task. Creates a message based on the passed-in Action and the owner's location, then sends that message to the recipient's phone.
        Parameters:
        recipient - the PlayerCharacter to send the request to
        task - the Action that the sender needs help with

      • receiveAndRespondToHelpRequest

        java.lang.Boolean receiveAndRespondToHelpRequest(PlayerCharacter sender,
                                                 Action task)
        Receives a request for help from another PlayerCharacter, the sender, gets the receiving player's response, and sends that back
        Parameters:
        sender - the PlayerCharacter who sent the original message
        task - the Action that the sender needs help with
        Returns:
        true if the receiver will help the sender, false if the opposite

      • getResponse

        java.lang.Boolean getResponse()
        Receives the response to a request for help sent to another PlayerCharacter
        Returns:
        true if the responder has chosen to help, false if the opposite
